title: Dashboard User Guide
text: quarrisk interactive dashboard helps explore quarantine outbreak risk different assumptions basic reproduction number (R‚ÇÄ), vaccine effectiveness (VE), vaccination coverage. guide walks feature explains interpret visualizations.

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Load package launch app: dashboard opens default browser. doesn‚Äôt, check R console local URL (e.g., http://127.0.0.1:####).
code: library(quarrisk)  # Launch with default settings run_app()  # Launch on a specific port (useful if default is busy) run_app(port = 3838)  # Launch without auto-opening a browser run_app(launch.browser = FALSE)

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: dashboard three tabs sidebar: Overview ‚Äî Quick scenario summary, value boxes, traveller vs worker comparison Risk Explorer ‚Äî Probability lines VE heatmap across R‚ÇÄ √ó coverage Timing Summary ‚Äî Median (chance50) tail (chance95) days outbreak tab controls, visualizations, interpretation tips.

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Provide fast, high-level snapshot selected scenario (R‚ÇÄ, VE, coverage), comparing traveller vs worker outbreak probability showing nearest-scenario summaries.

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Nearest Scenario: Shows closest grid point chosen R‚ÇÄ/VE/coverage Traveller vs Worker: Side--side outbreak probabilities Quick Timing: Median (chance50) tail (chance95) days outbreak

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Parameters: R‚ÇÄ, VE, coverage mean model Data Source Notes: tidy datasets assembled

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: simple bar dot comparison traveller vs worker current scenario. interact - Adjust R‚ÇÄ, VE, coverage controls - Watch value boxes comparison chart update real time look - Differences traveller worker pathways scenario - scenario movements (e.g., higher VE) shift probabilities

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Parameter sensitivity: Increasing VE coverage usually lowers outbreak probability. Operational context: Similar probabilities can imply different risks depending volumes response capacity. Nearest scenario: Values come closest grid point; small rounding expected.

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Explore outbreak probability responds VE (line plot) across R‚ÇÄ √ó coverage grid (heatmap).

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Fix R‚ÇÄ & coverage line plot (probability vs VE) Select pathway (traveller / worker / ) Heatmap settings (toggle labels, percent format)

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: X-axis: VE (0‚Äì1) Y-axis: Outbreak probability (0‚Äì1, commonly shown %) Lines: Traveller vs worker (selected) use - Hold R‚ÇÄ coverage fixed, sweep VE see reduction curves - Compare pathway curves gauge sensitivity look - Thresholds probability drops quickly - Gaps pathways equal VE

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: X-axis: Coverage Y-axis: R‚ÇÄ Fill: Outbreak probability (percent) use - Scan cooler regions (lower probability) higher VE/coverage - Identify hot zones high R‚ÇÄ low coverage Interpretation - Higher R‚ÇÄ generally raises risk; higher coverage (VE) dampens - Use percent labels compare grid cells quickly

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Understand outbreaks might occur: median (chance50) tail (chance95) days outbreak, across scenarios.

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Toggle chance50 chance95 Lines coverage fixed R‚ÇÄ & VE Lines R‚ÇÄ fixed VE & coverage Option display metrics together context read - Longer times suggest lead time detection/response - Tail days (chance95) indicate worst-case waiting times look - Whether improving VE/coverage meaningfully extends chance50/chance95 - Sensitivity timing R‚ÇÄ fixed VE/coverage

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Sidebar switch tabs Active tab highlighted Collapsible info boxes background & tips

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Hover precise values (percents shown %) Legend toggles (available) show/hide series Download: Use built-table/plot export buttons

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Use modern browser (Chrome/Firefox/Safari/Edge). Avoid excessively fine slider steps rendering slows. plot busy, hide labels display one pathway time.

what: Why do values change only at certain points?
title: Dashboard User Guide
text: underlying data scenario grid; inputs snap nearest grid point display.

what: Why do traveller and worker differ?
title: Dashboard User Guide
text: represent distinct introduction pathways different modeled probabilities.

what: Can I export numbers I see?
title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Yes‚Äîuse underlying datasets programmatically:
code: data(ob_summary, package = "quarrisk") data(ob_probs_travellers, package = "quarrisk") data(ob_timings_summary, package = "quarrisk")  # Example: pull a specific scenario dplyr::filter(ob_summary, r0 == 5, ve == 0.6, coverage == 0.5)

what: How do I cite or report values?
title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Report R‚ÇÄ, VE, coverage, pathway, whether ‚Äôre using chance50 chance95.

title: Dashboard User Guide
code: library(quarrisk) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(scales) theme_set(theme_bw(base_size = 13))  # Slice a scenario data(ob_summary) slice <- ob_summary |>   dplyr::filter(r0 == 5, ve == 0.6, coverage == 0.5) slice  # Helper plot: probability vs VE at fixed R0 & coverage # p <- plot_risk_vs_ve(r0 = 5, coverage = 0.5, data = ob_summary) # p

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: Vignette visible website Make sure file vignettes/ ‚Äôve rebuilt site (pushed using GitHub Pages/Actions). Site didn‚Äôt update using Actions, check ‚Äúpkgdown‚Äù workflow logs GitHub. using gh-pages /docs, re-run pkgdown::build_site() push generated content/branch. Plots slow render Reduce number labels pathways shown, widen browser window.

title: Dashboard User Guide
text: ?run_app ‚Äî Launch dashboard ?ob_summary, ?ob_probs_travellers, ?ob_timings_summary ‚Äî Datasets ?slice_scenario, ?plot_risk_vs_ve ‚Äî Helper functions

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: quarrisk package provides interactive Shiny dashboard helper functions explore quarantine outbreak risk different assumptions basic reproduction number (R‚ÇÄ), vaccine effectiveness (VE), vaccination coverage. includes three tidy datasets: ob_probs_travellers: outbreak probabilities traveller worker pathways ob_timings_summary: median (50%) tail (95%) days outbreak ob_summary: joined grid probabilities + timings across R‚ÇÄ √ó VE √ó coverage Use dashboard scan scenarios quickly, use datasets/functions programmatic analysis.

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Install GitHub:
code: # Install devtools if you haven't already install.packages("remotes")  # Install quarrisk remotes::install_github("ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-Yashitta")

title: Introduction to quarrisk
code: library(quarrisk) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(scales) library(knitr) library(tidyverse) library(kableExtra) theme_set(theme_bw(base_size = 13))

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Key variables - r0: basic reproduction number - ve: vaccine effectiveness (0‚Äì1) - coverage: population coverage (0‚Äì1) - traveller_ob_prob, worker_ob_prob: outbreak probabilities pathway
code: data(ob_probs_travellers, package = "quarrisk")  ob_probs_travellers |>   dplyr::transmute(     r0, ve, coverage,     `Traveller prob` = scales::percent(traveller_ob_prob, accuracy = 0.01),     `Worker prob`    = scales::percent(worker_ob_prob,    accuracy = 0.01)   ) |>   head(6) |>   knitr::kable(     format = "pipe",     col.names = c("R‚ÇÄ", "VE", "Coverage", "Traveller prob", "Worker prob"),     align = "rrrcc")

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Key variables - chance50: median days outbreak - chance95: tail (95th percentile) days outbreak
code: data(ob_timings_summary, package = "quarrisk")  ob_timings_summary |>   dplyr::transmute(     r0, ve, coverage,     `Median days (chance50)` = round(chance50, 2),     `Tail days (chance95)`   = round(chance95, 2)   ) |>   head(6) |>   knitr::kable(     format    = "pipe",     col.names = c("R‚ÇÄ","VE","Coverage","Median days (chance50)","Tail days (chance95)"),     align     = "rrrcc")

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: convenient join across full scenario grid (R‚ÇÄ √ó VE √ó coverage).
code: data(ob_summary, package = "quarrisk")  ob_summary |>   dplyr::mutate(     traveller_ob_prob = scales::percent(traveller_ob_prob, accuracy = 0.01),     worker_ob_prob    = scales::percent(worker_ob_prob,    accuracy = 0.01),     chance50 = round(chance50, 1),     chance95 = round(chance95, 1)   ) |>   dplyr::select(r0, ve, coverage,                 traveller_ob_prob, worker_ob_prob,                 chance50, chance95) |>   head(6) |>   knitr::kable(     format    = "pipe",     col.names = c("R‚ÇÄ", "VE", "Coverage",                   "Traveller prob", "Worker prob",                   "Median days", "Tail days"),     align     = "rrrccrr")

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Launch Shiny dashboard: app provides three tabs: - Overview ‚Äî Nearest scenario chosen R‚ÇÄ/VE/coverage, value boxes, quick traveller vs worker comparison - Risk Explorer ‚Äî Lines (probability vs VE) heatmap (probability R‚ÇÄ √ó coverage) - Timing Summary ‚Äî Median (chance50) tail (chance95) days vs coverage/R‚ÇÄ
code: run_app()

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Compare traveller vs worker probabilities fixed scenario quick bar comparison:
code: picked <- ob_summary |>   dplyr::filter(r0 == 5, ve == 0.6, coverage == 0.5) |>   dplyr::transmute(     r0, ve, coverage,     traveller = traveller_ob_prob,     worker    = worker_ob_prob,     gap       = traveller - worker   )  picked |>   dplyr::transmute(     r0, ve, coverage,     `Traveller prob` = scales::percent(traveller, accuracy = 0.01),     `Worker prob`    = scales::percent(worker,    accuracy = 0.01),     `Gap`            = scales::percent(gap,       accuracy = 0.01)   ) |>   knitr::kable(     format    = "pipe",     col.names = c("R‚ÇÄ","VE","Coverage","Traveller prob","Worker prob","Gap"),     align     = "rrrccc") bar <- picked |>   tidyr::pivot_longer(     cols = tidyselect::any_of(c("traveller_ob_prob","worker_ob_prob","traveller","worker")),     names_to = "pathway", values_to = "prob"   ) |>   dplyr::filter(!is.na(prob)) |>   dplyr::mutate(     pathway = dplyr::recode(       pathway,       traveller_ob_prob = "Traveller",       worker_ob_prob    = "Worker",       traveller         = "Traveller",       worker            = "Worker"     )   )  ggplot2::ggplot(bar, ggplot2::aes(pathway, prob, fill = pathway)) +   ggplot2::geom_col(width = 0.6) +   ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +   ggplot2::scale_fill_manual(values = c("Traveller" = "#34b679", "Worker" = "#7b4397")) +   ggplot2::labs(x = NULL, y = "Outbreak probability",                 title = "Traveller vs Worker (R0=5, VE=60%, Coverage=50%)") +   ggplot2::theme_bw(base_size = 13) +   ggplot2::theme(legend.position = "none")

what: Probability vs VE at fixed R‚ÇÄ & coverage
title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Use exported helper plot_risk_vs_ve():
code: r0_val  <- 5 cov_val <- 0.5  p <- ob_summary |>   dplyr::filter(r0 == r0_val, coverage == cov_val) |>   tidyr::pivot_longer(     c(traveller_ob_prob, worker_ob_prob),     names_to = "pathway", values_to = "prob"   ) |>   dplyr::mutate(     pathway = dplyr::recode(pathway,       traveller_ob_prob = "Traveller",       worker_ob_prob    = "Worker"     )   )  ggplot2::ggplot(p, ggplot2::aes(ve, prob, linetype = pathway)) +   ggplot2::geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +   ggplot2::labs(     x = "VE", y = "Outbreak probability", linetype = "Pathway",     title = sprintf("R0 = %.1f, coverage = %.2f", r0_val, cov_val))

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Median days outbreak across coverage (fixed R‚ÇÄ VE):  Tail days vs R‚ÇÄ (fixed VE coverage):
code: tc <- ob_summary |>   dplyr::filter(r0 == 5, ve == 0.6) |>   dplyr::arrange(coverage)  ggplot2::ggplot(tc, ggplot2::aes(coverage, chance50)) +   ggplot2::geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 1.5) +   ggplot2::scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +   ggplot2::labs(     x = "Coverage", y = "Median days (chance50)",     title = "Timing vs Coverage at R0=5, VE=60%"   ) tail_timing_by_r0 <- ob_summary |>   dplyr::filter(ve == 0.6, coverage == 0.5) |>   dplyr::arrange(r0)  ggplot2::ggplot(tail_timing_by_r0, ggplot2::aes(r0, chance95)) +   ggplot2::geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 1.5) +   ggplot2::labs(     x = "R0", y = "Tail days (chance95)",     title = "Tail Timing vs R0 at VE=60%, Coverage=50%")

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: slice_scenario(r0, ve, coverage) ‚Äî returns rows matching (nearest ) scenario plot_risk_vs_ve(r0, coverage, data) ‚Äî line plot outbreak probability vs VE Example:
code: tab <- quarrisk::slice_scenario(ob_summary, r0 = 5, ve = 0.6, coverage = 0.5) |>   dplyr::transmute(     r0, ve, coverage,     `Traveller prob` = scales::percent(traveller_ob_prob, accuracy = 0.01),     `Worker prob`    = scales::percent(worker_ob_prob,    accuracy = 0.01),     `Median days`    = round(chance50, 2),     `Tail days`      = round(chance95, 2)   )  knitr::kable(tab, format="pipe",              col.names=c("R‚ÇÄ","VE","Coverage","Traveller prob",                          "Worker prob","Median days","Tail days"),              align="rrrccrr")

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Use percentages scanning heatmaps/lines (format VE coverage scales::percent). Compare pathways ‚Äî traveller vs worker risks can diverge scenario. Look timing, just probability ‚Äî longer chance50/chance95 may buy response time. Context matters ‚Äî probability can imply different operational risks depending volume, import controls, response capacity.

title: Introduction to quarrisk
text: Launch dashboard: run_app() Browse function docs: ?run_app, ?slice_scenario, ?plot_risk_vs_ve Explore datasets: ?ob_summary, ?ob_probs_travellers, ?ob_timings_summary

title: quarrisk
text: quarrisk provides interactive Shiny dashboard helper functions explore quarantine outbreak risk different assumptions basic reproduction number (R‚ÇÄ), vaccine effectiveness (VE), vaccination coverage. ships three tidy datasets: ob_probs_travellers ‚Äî outbreak probabilities traveller/worker pathway ob_timings_summary ‚Äî median (50%) tail (95%) days outbreak ob_summary ‚Äî joined grid probabilities + timings across R‚ÇÄ √ó VE √ó coverage dashboard three tabs: Overview, Risk Explorer, Timing Summary.

title: quarrisk
text: üì¶ Three curated datasets covering probabilities timing üß≠ Overview: nearest-scenario readout + quick comparison traveller vs worker risk üìà Risk Explorer: lines heatmaps see risk changes VE, R‚ÇÄ, coverage ‚è±Ô∏è Timing Summary: median tail time--outbreak profiles üß∞ Helpers: slice_scenario() grab scenarios; plot_risk_vs_ve() plot VE curves üñ•Ô∏è One-line app launcher: run_app()

title: quarrisk
text: can install development version quarrisk GitHub :
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-Yashitta")

title: quarrisk
code: library(quarrisk)

title: quarrisk
code: data(ob_probs_travellers) head(ob_probs_travellers) data(ob_timings_summary) head(ob_timings_summary) data(ob_summary) dplyr::glimpse(ob_summary)

title: quarrisk
code: run_app()

title: quarrisk
text: Overview ‚Äì Shows nearest scenario chosen R‚ÇÄ / VE / coverage, value boxes, quick traveller vs worker probability comparison. Risk Explorer ‚Äì Lines: outbreak probability vs VE fixed R‚ÇÄ & coverage Heatmap: probability across R‚ÇÄ √ó coverage fixed VE Timing Summary ‚Äì Median (chance50) tail (chance95) days vs coverage / R‚ÇÄ selected VE.

title: quarrisk
text: Compute gap traveller worker outbreak probabilities given scenario grid:

title: quarrisk
text: ob_probs_travellers ‚Äî Tibble columns: r0, ve, coverage, traveller_ob_prob, worker_ob_prob. ob_timings_summary ‚Äî Tibble columns: r0, ve, coverage, chance50, chance95. ob_summary ‚Äî Join two across full scenario grid.

title: quarrisk
text: run_app() ‚Äî Launch Shiny dashboard. slice_scenario(r0, ve, coverage) ‚Äî Return rows matching (nearest ) scenario. plot_risk_vs_ve(r0, coverage, pathway = c("traveller_ob_prob","worker_ob_prob")) ‚Äî Line plot outbreak probability vs VE fixed R‚ÇÄ & coverage.

title: quarrisk
text: Package repo: https://github.com/ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages--shiny-apps-Yashitta.git Pkgdown site: https://etc5523-2025.github.io/assignment-4-packages--shiny-apps-Yashitta/

what: Outbreak probabilities by traveller type ‚Äî ob_probs_travellers
title: Outbreak probabilities by traveller type ‚Äî ob_probs_travellers
text: Scenario grid outbreak probabilities travellers workers, indexed basic reproduction number (R0), vaccine effectiveness (VE), vaccine coverage. Values probabilities [0, 1].

title: Outbreak probabilities by traveller type ‚Äî ob_probs_travellers
code: ob_probs_travellers

title: Outbreak probabilities by traveller type ‚Äî ob_probs_travellers
text: tibble one row per scenario: r0 Basic reproduction number used scenario. ve Vaccine effectiveness (0‚Äì1). coverage Population vaccine coverage (0‚Äì1). traveller_ob_prob Outbreak probability traveller pathway. worker_ob_prob Outbreak probability worker pathway.

title: Outbreak probabilities by traveller type ‚Äî ob_probs_travellers
text: data-raw/ob_probs_travellers.csv

title: Outbreak probabilities by traveller type ‚Äî ob_probs_travellers
text: Scenarios form regular grid R0, VE coverage. Probabilities derived branching-process model used assignment brief.

title: Outbreak probabilities by traveller type ‚Äî ob_probs_travellers
code: data(ob_probs_travellers) # quick peek head(ob_probs_travellers) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 5 #>      r0    ve coverage traveller_ob_prob worker_ob_prob #>   <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>             <dbl>          <dbl> #> 1     5   0.5      0.1           0.00903          0.146 #> 2     6   0.5      0.1           0.0135           0.164 #> 3     7   0.5      0.1           0.0137           0.175 #> 4     8   0.5      0.1           0.0188           0.182 #> 5     9   0.5      0.1           0.0203           0.197 #> 6    10   0.5      0.1           0.0210           0.203

title: Combined outbreak summary (probabilities + timings) ‚Äî ob_summary
text: Convenience dataset joins probabilities timing measures common scenario grid. Handy plotting Shiny filtering without performing join runtime.

title: Combined outbreak summary (probabilities + timings) ‚Äî ob_summary
code: ob_summary

title: Combined outbreak summary (probabilities + timings) ‚Äî ob_summary
text: tibble columns sources: r0 Basic reproduction number. ve Vaccine effectiveness (0‚Äì1). coverage Vaccine coverage (0‚Äì1). traveller_ob_prob Outbreak probability travellers. worker_ob_prob Outbreak probability workers. chance50 Median days outbreak. chance95 95th-percentile days outbreak.

title: Combined outbreak summary (probabilities + timings) ‚Äî ob_summary
text: Created data-raw/build-quarrisk-data.R inner join ob_probs_travellers ob_timings_summary.

title: Outbreak timing summary ‚Äî ob_timings_summary
text: Summary expected time outbreak scenario grid, reported median days 95th-percentile days.

title: Outbreak timing summary ‚Äî ob_timings_summary
code: ob_timings_summary

title: Outbreak timing summary ‚Äî ob_timings_summary
text: tibble one row per scenario: r0 Basic reproduction number. ve Vaccine effectiveness (0‚Äì1). coverage Vaccine coverage (0‚Äì1). chance50 Median days outbreak. chance95 95th-percentile days outbreak.

title: Outbreak timing summary ‚Äî ob_timings_summary
text: data-raw/ob_timings_summary.csv

title: Outbreak timing summary ‚Äî ob_timings_summary
text: Larger values chance50 chance95 indicate slower expected outbreak timing (.e. time outbreak occurs).

title: Outbreak timing summary ‚Äî ob_timings_summary
code: data(ob_timings_summary) # typical ranges by R0 dplyr::group_by(ob_timings_summary, r0) |>   dplyr::summarise(med = median(chance50), p95 = median(chance95)) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 3 #>      r0   med   p95 #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     3  16.4  70.6 #> 2     5 217.  947.  #> 3     6 154.  680.  #> 4     7 115.  498.  #> 5     8  95.0 420.  #> 6     9  76.7 335.  #> 7    10  60.9 259.

what: Plot outbreak probability vs vaccine effectiveness (VE) ‚Äî plot_risk_vs_ve
title: Plot outbreak probability vs vaccine effectiveness (VE) ‚Äî plot_risk_vs_ve
text: given basic reproduction number (R0) vaccine coverage, function plots outbreak probability vaccine effectiveness (VE) using ob_summary grid. traveller worker pathways shown comparison.

title: Plot outbreak probability vs vaccine effectiveness (VE) ‚Äî plot_risk_vs_ve
code: plot_risk_vs_ve(data = quarrisk::ob_summary, r0, coverage, show_points = FALSE)

title: Plot outbreak probability vs vaccine effectiveness (VE) ‚Äî plot_risk_vs_ve
text: data Tibble columns r0, ve, coverage, traveller_ob_prob, worker_ob_prob. Defaults quarrisk::ob_summary. r0 Numeric, target basic reproduction number. coverage Numeric [0, 1], target vaccine coverage. show_points Logical; TRUE, also draw points lines.

title: Plot outbreak probability vs vaccine effectiveness (VE) ‚Äî plot_risk_vs_ve
text: ggplot2 object showing outbreak probability vs VE specified r0 coverage.

title: Plot outbreak probability vs vaccine effectiveness (VE) ‚Äî plot_risk_vs_ve
text: function filters scenario grid rows requested r0 coverage (exact matches grid), plots traveller worker outbreak probabilities function VE.

title: Plot outbreak probability vs vaccine effectiveness (VE) ‚Äî plot_risk_vs_ve
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Basic usage   plot_risk_vs_ve(r0 = 2, coverage = 0.8)    # With points   plot_risk_vs_ve(r0 = 3, coverage = 0.6, show_points = TRUE) } # }

what: Launch the quarrisk Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
title: Launch the quarrisk Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
text: Launches interactive Shiny dashboard exploring outbreak risk scenarios using packaged datasets ob_probs_travellers, ob_timings_summary, joined ob_summary. app includes: Overview: Headline metrics nearest scenario Risk vs VE: Traveller/worker outbreak probability across VE Timing: Median / 95th percentile days--outbreak summaries

title: Launch the quarrisk Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
code: run_app(...)

title: Launch the quarrisk Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
text: ... Passed runApp (e.g., port, host, launch.browser).

title: Launch the quarrisk Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
text: return value; called side effects (starts app).

title: Launch the quarrisk Interactive Dashboard ‚Äî run_app
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Launch the dashboard (default browser)   run_app()    # Launch on a specific port   run_app(port = 3838)    # Launch without opening the browser automatically   run_app(launch.browser = FALSE) } # }

what: Slice the scenario grid (nearest R0 / VE / coverage) ‚Äî slice_scenario
title: Slice the scenario grid (nearest R0 / VE / coverage) ‚Äî slice_scenario
text: Convenience helper quarrisk datasets. Given desired basic reproduction number (R0), vaccine effectiveness (VE), vaccine coverage, finds nearest scenario model grid (e.g. ob_summary) returns row tibble.

title: Slice the scenario grid (nearest R0 / VE / coverage) ‚Äî slice_scenario
code: slice_scenario(data, r0, ve, coverage)

title: Slice the scenario grid (nearest R0 / VE / coverage) ‚Äî slice_scenario
text: data tibble/data.frame containing columns r0, ve, coverage (typically ob_summary one filtered variants). r0 Numeric, desired basic reproduction number. ve Numeric [0, 1], desired vaccine effectiveness. coverage Numeric [0, 1], desired vaccine coverage.

title: Slice the scenario grid (nearest R0 / VE / coverage) ‚Äî slice_scenario
text: 1-row tibble matched scenario, including: r0 Nearest R0 grid. ve Nearest VE grid. coverage Nearest coverage grid. traveller_ob_prob Outbreak probability (traveller pathway). worker_ob_prob Outbreak probability (worker pathway). chance50 Median days outbreak. chance95 95th-percentile days outbreak.

title: Slice the scenario grid (nearest R0 / VE / coverage) ‚Äî slice_scenario
text: ‚ÄúNearest‚Äù computed independently along axis (R0, VE, coverage) choosing grid value minimum absolute difference requested value. mirrors sliders Shiny app snap nearest available scenario.

title: Slice the scenario grid (nearest R0 / VE / coverage) ‚Äî slice_scenario
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   data(ob_summary)   slice_scenario(ob_summary, r0 = 2, ve = 0.80, coverage = 0.80) } # }
